meanings.definition: After the expected, usual, or proper time.
meanings.sent1: She arrived late to the party.
meanings.sent2: He missed the bus because he woke up late.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit was late for the tea party, but the Mad Hatter didn't mind.
meanings.sent4: The sun sets late in the summer, painting the sky in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The student's late arrival to class resulted in a scolding from the teacher.

meanings.sent1: The late actor's final movie was released posthumously.
meanings.sent2: The family mourned the loss of their late grandmother.
meanings.sent3: The late flowers in the garden seemed to bloom even more beautifully.
meanings.sent4: The late autumn leaves whispered their farewell to the trees.
meanings.sent5: The late king's portrait hung solemnly in the great hall.

meanings.sent1: The late stages of the project required extra effort to complete.
meanings.sent2: The late hours of the night were filled with quiet contemplation.
meanings.sent3: The late dinosaurs roamed the earth millions of years ago.
meanings.sent4: The late empire's ruins stood as a testament to its former glory.
meanings.sent5: The late summer sun cast long shadows across the fields.
